abstract.text: An object that describes the configuration of a subscription’s push notifications.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: When configuring a subscription, use this class to specify the type of push notifications you want to generate when conditions meet the subscription’s trigger. You can provide content that the system displays to the user, describe the sounds to play, and indicate whether the app’s icon has a badge. You can request that the notification include information about the record that triggers it.
When your app receives a push notification that a subscription generates, instantiate an instance of
method and pass the notification’s payload. The object that the method returns contains the data you specify when configuring the subscription.
For more information about push notification alerts and how they display to the user, see
If you don’t set any of the
properties, CloudKit sends the push notification using a lower priority and doesn’t display any content to the user.

abstract.text: Store structured app and user data in iCloud containers that all users of your app can share.
The abstract base class for CloudKit notifications.
Creates a new notification using the specified payload data.
The fields for building a notification’s alert.
The names of fields to include in the push notification’s payload.
The fields for building a notification’s subtitle.
The fields for building a notification’s title.
An abstract base class for subscriptions.
An object that describes the configuration of a subscription’s push notifications.
The key that identifies the localized string for the notification’s action.
The text for the notification’s alert.
The filename of an image to use as a launch image.
The fields for building a notification’s alert.
The key that identifies the localized string for the notification’s alert.
The name of the action group that corresponds to this notification.
A value that the system uses to coalesce unseen push notifications.
The names of fields to include in the push notification’s payload.
Creates a notification with the specified values.
A Boolean value that determines whether an app’s icon badge increments its value.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the push notification includes the content available flag.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the push notification sets the mutable content flag.
The filename of the sound file to play when a notification arrives.
The notification’s subtitle.
The fields for building a notification’s subtitle.
The key that identifies the localized string for the notification’s subtitle.
The notification’s title.
The fields for building a notification’s title.
The key that identifies the localized string for the notification’s title.
The configuration for a subscription’s push notifications.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

https://developer.apple.com/library/arch.title: Local and Remote Notification Programming Guide
